EDGE TERMS AND CONDITIONS

AND RELEASE AND WAIVER OF LIABILITY

PLEASE READ THE EDGE TERMS AND CONDITIONS RELEASE AND WAIVER OF LIABILITY (“AGREEMENT”) CAREFULLY. IT AFFECTS THE LEGAL RIGHTS OF EACH GUEST THAT OBTAINS A TICKET TO OR ENTERS THE EDGE EXPERIENCE AT HUDSON YARDS (THE “EDGE”).

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. I am aware and understand that the Edge is an observation deck and experience that inherently involves potential risks and dangers associated with interacting with and in, and traversing through, in and/or around, an observation deck experience. Those risks may include, for example, slipping, being knocked off balance, falling, exposure to heights (which may cause vertigo, nausea, or discomfort), exposure to flashing or intermittent special effects or lighting, personal injury, or death.

ASSUMPTION OF RISKS. DESPITE THE RISKS AND DANGERS INHERENT IN VISITING THE EDGE, I AGREE TO ASSUME ANY AND ALL RISKS CONNECTED WITH THE EDGE, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, PERSONAL INJURY, ILLNESS, DEATH, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR LOSS.

COMPANY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY OF ACCURACY OR QUALITY AND ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NONINFRINGEMENT AND ASSUMES NO LIABILITY FOR ANY LOSS, INJURY, OR DAMAGE, INCLUDING PHYSICAL INJURY OR DAMAGES OR LOSS TO PROPERTY.

DISPUTES. Any dispute or claim relating in any way to the Edge or Company will be resolved by binding arbitration, rather than in court. The Federal Arbitration Act and federal arbitration law, and the laws of the State of New York, apply to this agreement and any matters relating to this Agreement. There is no judge or jury in arbitration, and court review of an arbitration award is limited. However, an arbitrator can award on an individual basis the same damages and relief as a court (including injunctive and declaratory relief or statutory damages), and must follow this Agreement as a court would. To begin an arbitration proceeding, you must send a letter requesting arbitration and describing your claim to: c/o The Related Companies, L.P., 30 Hudson Yards, New York, New York 10001, Attention: Hudson Yards, General Counsel. The arbitration will be conducted by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) under its rules, including the AAA's Supplementary Procedures for Consumer-Related Disputes. The AAA's rules are available at www.adr.org or by calling 1-800-778-7879. Payment of all filing, administration and arbitrator fees will be governed by the AAA's rules. You may choose to have the arbitration conducted by telephone, based on written submissions, or in person in the county where you live or at another mutually agreed location. We each agree that any dispute resolution proceedings will be conducted only on an individual basis and not in a class, consolidated, or representative action. If for any reason a claim proceeds in court rather than in arbitration, we each waive any right to a jury trial and agree that any such court proceeding must take place in a federal or state court located in New York County, State of New York. I irrevocably consent and submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts and waive any claim that any such court is an inconvenient forum or venue.

NOTICE OF FILMING OR RECORDING. I understand that I may be photographed, filmed, or otherwise recorded at the Edge, and that all photographs, recordings, and video footage taken of me by or on behalf of the Company while at the Edge (“Recordings”) will be the property solely of Company. As the owner of the Recordings, subject to Company’s compliance with applicable laws, Company has the unconditional, irrevocable right to use the Recordings in all media and formats, whether now or later known or developed.

FITNESS AND RESPONSIBLE BEHAVIOR. I represent that I (and any minor children or other people under my responsibility or control): (a) am not under the influence of any alcohol, drugs, or medications that would alter or impair my or their senses, judgment, or fitness for participation; (b) am not aware of any physical, emotional, or other condition that could create a hazard to me or others as a result of entering or experiencing the Edge; and (c) will act responsibly during my participation with and at the Edge in accordance with all of the Edge’s rules, regulations, procedures and standards of conduct set forth herein or otherwise posted on the Edge’s premises or in its vicinity.

I also give permission to the health care professional selected by Company to examine, diagnose and treat me, or secure treatment for me, if proper and necessary under the circumstances. I acknowledge that I am solely responsible for any and all charges for medical services provided to me or on my behalf and for carrying my own health insurance. The waiver and release of liability in this Agreement extends to any liability arising out of or in any way connected with any such medical treatment and transportation I receive or any failure to provide such treatment or transportation.

I agree that if I refuse to submit to such search or am found to be in possession of dangerous or unsuitable materials (as determined in Company’s sole discretion), I may be refused entry to or removed from the Edge and its vicinity.

BY PURCHASING A TICKET TO OR ENTERING THE EDGE, I UNDERSTAND THAT I AM VOLUNTARILY GIVING UP CERTAIN LEGAL RIGHTS, INCLUDING THE RIGHT TO SUE THE RELEASED PARTIES.

THE EDGE GUEST RULES AND POLICIES

1. Admission & Ticketing.

Guests must have a valid ticket to enter the Edge.

Tickets are valid for the date and/or time specified on your ticket. If you are late, you may be permitted to enter at later time slot; however, admission is not guaranteed and is subject to availability.

Flex Admission tickets are for the date specified on your ticket are good for one-time entrance to Edge during operating hours (as may be updated from time to time) of selected day.

Annual Pass includes:

Unlimited access to Edge during operating hours (as may be updated from time to time), valid for one (1) year starting from date of first visit

Flexible arrival time for each visit

Digital membership card

10% discount at Edge retail stores

2-for-1 City Climb tickets: buy one and get the second one for free. City Climb Terms and Conditions apply.

Free access and/or discounts to select special events

Annual Passes are non-refundable and non-transferable. Must be redeemed within one (1) year from date of purchase. Annual Pass benefits are for personal, non-commercial use only. Benefits and prices are subject to change. A photo will be required to obtain an Annual Pass.

Children 5 years old or younger do not need a ticket and may attend the Edge when accompanied by an adult ticket holder.

Children must be accompanied and supervised by an adult.

Re-entry to the Edge is not permitted. If you leave Edge, you cannot re-enter without obtaining a new ticket.

Tickets purchased via the Website are non-refundable. There will be no refunds provided to guests for any reason, including due to weather conditions, length of lines, or wait times at the building. Lost, stolen, or destroyed tickets are not replaceable.

Our Sky Assurance Weather Guarantee provides you with three (3) options if bad weather affects the day of your visit (offers can only be redeemed in person and on site at Guest Services; offer only valid before Edge ticket has been activated; only one (1) option from the below may be redeemed per Edge ticket):

Option 1 - Visit Edge Today: Visit Edge today and enjoy 20% off at the Edge bar. A voucher will be handed to you by our Guest Services team on the day of your visit. Offer can only be redeemed on the date displayed on the voucher, only valid for one (1) transaction. Only one (1) voucher can be redeemed per person. Redeemable at any permanent Edge bar on Level 100 and 101. Non transferrable / not for resale or exchange / non-refundable / void if altered.

Option 2 - Option 2 - Visit MoMA and Come Back to Edge Later: Exchange your Edge ticket for a ticket to visit The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and enjoy 50% off your next visit to Edge. The ticket to MoMA and the Edge voucher will be handed to you by our Guest Services team on the day of your visit. Edge voucher is non-refundable and non-transferable, valid for six (6) months from exchange date. Only one (1) voucher can be redeemed per person. Non transferrable / not for resale or exchange / non-refundable / void if altered. MoMA ticket is non-refundable and non-transferable, valid for a term as indicated on ticket. Only one (1) MoMA ticket can be redeemed per person. MoMA ticket non transferrable / not for resale or exchange / non-refundable / void if altered / terms and conditions of MoMA ticket apply. Limited time offer, MoMA ticket may be replaced by a ticket to another indoor NYC attraction, at Company’s sole discretion.

Option 3 – Visit Edge Later: Rebook your ticket for a new date.

We reserve the right, at all times, in our sole discretion, to expel, or prohibit guest access to the Edge for any reason, including (i) the termination of all general public access during the time guests are otherwise scheduled to have access; (ii) to comply with applicable law or requests from law enforcement; (iii) for security reasons; or (iv) any violation of the Agreement, including these Guest Rules and Policies.

2. Access for Individuals with Disabilities. The Edge is wheelchair accessible. The Edge space is accessible with the use of ramps and elevators. Individuals who require, or anticipate a need for, assistance should contact Edge on-site staff, or are encouraged to email [email protected] or call 332-204-8500 in advance of visiting the Edge.

3. Group Booking.

Group reservations are required for groups of 15 or more. Please contact us at 1-332-204-8500 or email us at [email protected] to inquire about your group visit.

Group reservations must be made in advance and payment must be received four weeks prior to visit.

Group size may be limited per time slot, subject to availability. Some blackout or other restrictions may apply.

One chaperone per every 10 guests (ages 0-18) are required. Chaperones must remain with the group at all times. Chaperones must be older than 21 years to qualify as a chaperone.

No refunds shall be issued in the event of closure due to weather.

We reserve the right to refuse or dismiss any group for misconduct.

Unapproved third-party guided tours are not permitted inside Edge.

4. Permitted Areas and Safety. You must remain within permitted areas as designated by Company or the Edge staff members. You must follow any instructions given by Company or staff members. All guests are responsible for their own safety and for the safety of any accompanying children.

5. CCTV, Security Recordings, and Personal Data. Company uses closed circuit television (CCTV) and other audio and visual recordings in the Edge for security reasons. By entering the Edge, you agree that Company may use such images and recordings for the purposes of maintaining and investigating safety and security at the Edge and within its vicinity in accordance with its Privacy Policy.

6, Prohibited Items. Company has the exclusive right to determine what items may be brought into the Edge. The Company may refuse entry or remove guests from the exhibition space if a guest attempts to bring or has brought a prohibited item into the Edge. The following items are prohibited:

Dangerous materials (including but not limited to): Weapons, fireworks, smoke bombs, glass bottles, flammable liquids.

Large Items (including but not limited to): Bags, bicycles, skateboards, roller skates, umbrellas or large photographic equipment.

Luggage: Guests may not bring any luggage of any kind into the exhibition space (luggage includes any parcel or backpack that is larger than 9 X 14 X 22).

Food and Drink. No food and drink (except water in clear plastic bottles) is allowed on the Edge. Glass bottles are strictly prohibited.

Pets or Animals. All pets or animals are expressly prohibited in the Edge, with the exception of service animals.

Audio and Visually Distracting Items (including but not limited to): Horns, whistles, megaphones, flags or banners are expressly prohibited.

7. Guest Conduct.

No Smoking. Smoking of any kind (including the use of e-cigarettes) is at all times strictly prohibited in the Edge.

Strollers. Strollers are permitted at the Edge but you may be asked to remove your child and fold your stroller up for access to the elevators as well as the escalators within the Edge experience.

Guest Photography and Video.

Guests may take personal photographs and personal video within the Edge solely for their private, personal, and non-commercial use. Guests may not for commercial purposes publish, sell, reproduce, transfer, distribute, or otherwise exploit videos and photographs taken within the Edge without Company’s advance written approval. Company must approve the creation of any commercial media, commercial photography or commercial video in advance in writing. Inquiries regarding commercial media or commercial photography may be directed to [email protected].

Guests should exercise caution when using cell phones and cameras and remain aware of their surroundings; failure to do so may lead to serious injury or death.

No running, jumping or playing in the Edge.

No signs or banners are permitted.

An inherent risk of community exposure to COVID-19 exists in any public place where people gather. COVID-19 is an extremely contagious disease that can lead to severe illness and death. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, senior citizens and people of any age with underlying medical conditions may be especially vulnerable.

We cannot guarantee you will not be exposed to someone who may be infected with COVID-19 during your visit.

By visiting Edge, you acknowledge and agree that you assume all inherent risks, including but not limited to risks arising from ordinary negligence, of exposure to COVID-19.

For the most updated, accurate information on COVID-19, turn to established public health resources, including the NYC Dept. of Health & Mental Hygiene, the New York State Dept. of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC).

CITY CLIMB

EFFECTIVE: JULY 19, 2022

CITY CLIMB HEALTH AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS AND TERMS AND CONDITIONS

AND RELEASE AND WAIVER OF LIABILITY

City Climb

HEALTH AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS

All participants must view and sign this document before participating in the City Climb activities.

You must not participate in the City Climb activities if you believe, or suspect, that your physical or mental condition may put your health and safety, or that of your minor participants, or other participants, at risk. If in doubt, speak to any City Climb staff member. Please be aware that even if you feel able to participate, you may be prohibited from doing so by the City Climb staff.

To help you assess your ability to participate, please carefully read and review the following health and safety information and check all that may apply to you, or the minor that you are signing on behalf of.

You should not participate in the City Climb activities if you:

Are pregnant or think you might be pregnant

Have broken bones or full or partial loss of limbs (prosthetics are not permitted)

Have undergone surgery in the past six months, have ever had surgery that would lead to a condition that would limit participation in physical activities, or are experiencing ongoing symptoms of any prior surgery

Have experienced a seizure or other disorder in the past six months

Have chest pains, shortness of breath, or a history of heart attack or stroke

Have any physical or mental condition that may affect you today or be triggered by the activities

Are under the influence of any drug (legal or illegal) or alcohol

The following conditions may impact your ability to participate safely in the City Climb activities:

All heart conditions (including high blood pressure)

All respiratory conditions (including asthma)

Vertigo, dizziness, or loss of balance

Diabetes or anaphylactic allergies

Seizures or other similar disorders

Visual impairment (prescription glasses or contact lenses are permitted)

In order to participate by walking the Course, you must:

Be a minimum age of 13 years old

A parent or legal guardian must complete the City Climb Terms and Conditions, Release and Waiver of Liability on behalf of any person under 18 years old

Be between 4’9” (1.45m) and 6’7” (2.0m) tall

Be a maximum clothed weight of 310lbs (140kg)

Be able to walk independently, have full body control, and have full hand-eye coordination

Be able to, and agree to, follow all verbal and visual instructions

City Climb activities are presented in English unless otherwise specified. For questions or inquiry into the availability in other languages, please contact [email protected].

SUMMARY OF CITY CLIMB PARTICIPANT RESPONSIBILITIES

Participant responsibilities:

There are inherent risks in the participation in or on any aerial adventure course or attraction of which requires appropriate patron awareness, participation, physical ability, and dexterity. Patrons of aerial adventure courses or attractions by participation accept the risks inherent in such participation which the ordinary prudent person is or should be aware. Patrons have a duty to exercise good judgement and act in a responsible manner while in or on any aerial adventure course, and to obey all verbal or written warnings before or during participation, or both.

Patrons have a duty to not participate in or on any aerial adventure course or attraction when under the influence of drugs or alcohol

Patrons have a duty to properly use all aerial adventure course safety equipment provided

Patrons have duty to not participate in or on any aerial adventure course when their physical condition will prevent safe participation

In addition to other activities, Participants agree to:

Be screened for weapons, explosives, alcohol, and other prohibited items by means of various devices administered by the City Climb staff, including by breathalyzer, and understand that the presence of any of the foregoing are grounds for exclusion from City Climb and removal from its property

Be subject to metal detection and a physical screen by the City Climb staff in order to remove all hazards

Be fitted into a special Climb Suit by the City Climb staff

Be latched and unlatched from the harness and lanyards by the City Climb staff

Be shown by the City Climb staff how to properly use the equipment

Be given instructions and demonstrations of the activities and rules by the City Climb staff

Demonstrate their ability to use the equipment safely and to manage risks properly before participating in and during the City Climb activities

Remain attached to lanyards at all times and be expected to follow all rules and direction by City Climb staff

Participants must be visible to the City Climb staff at all times during the activities in order for the staff to be able to observe health, safety, and medical issues and respond immediately should the need arise.
